meanings.definition: Protection or exemption from something, especially a disease or legal prosecution.
meanings.sent1: Having immunity from the flu helped her stay healthy during the winter.
meanings.sent2: The vaccine provided her with immunity against the virus.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his immunity from doing chores was his superpower.
meanings.sent4: Her immunity to stress made her a great leader in tough situations.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's immunity to bullets made him invincible in battle.

meanings.definition: The ability of an organism to resist a particular infection or toxin.
meanings.sent1: The baby's natural immunity protected her from getting sick.
meanings.sent2: His immunity to poison ivy allowed him to explore the forest without worry.
meanings.sent3: The cat's immunity to catnip made it the least playful of the litter.
meanings.sent4: Her immunity to bad vibes kept her positive even in difficult times.
meanings.sent5: The plant's immunity to pests made it thrive in the garden.
